intro: Geostachys kerrii, commonly known as the Kerri's geostachys, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in areas with moderate rainfall. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
